snippet: Changes in energy prices and dependence on foreign oil had little to do with the stimulus law, experts say, crediting them to government policies, market forces and private sector activities.

byline.original: By CORAL DAVENPORT and DIANE CARDWELL
byline.contributor: Coral Davenport reported from Washington, and Diane Cardwell from New York.

lead_paragraph: Changes in energy prices and dependence on foreign oil had little to do with the stimulus law, experts say, crediting them to government policies, market forces and private sector activities.
abstract: Pres Obama, during State of the Union address, proclaims successes of 2009 economic stimulus funding of clean and renewable energy; experts agree that strides were made in energy under Obama, but say many of changes resulted from government policy, market forces and private sector activity, rather than from stimulus.

headline.print_headline: President May Have Exaggerated Role of Stimulus in Clean Energy, Experts Say
headline.main: President May Have Exaggerated Role of Stimulus in Clean Energy, Experts Say
